Authors: Xiuyue Zhang, Jinnan Ma, Rongyan Gong
Title:
Population genetic structure and intraspecific genetic
distance of Periplaneta americana, based on mitochondrial COI
sequence
Keywords:
Haplotypes; Population structure; Genetic diversity;
Genetic distance; COI gene; Periplaneta americana
Abstract:
American cockroach is one of the highly diverse pests
which occurs with an almost worldwide distribution. Genetic population
structure and intraspecific genetic distance of Periplaneta americana
were determined by using DNA barcoding sequences of 18 groups from
China, and one group from USA, with a total of 760 specimens analysed.
10 haplotypes were defined from 18 groups in China, nine of which were
exclusive haplotypes in China. Compared with USA group, the genetic
diversity of China group was relatively low. Genetic isolation by
geographic partition was not observed distinctly among Chinese groups
considering the genetic divergence (Fst) and per-generation migration
rate (Nm), and phylogenetic analyses. These results indicated P.
americana among different sampled areas had low genetic divergence.
Phylogenetic analysis revealed four distinct P. americana haplotype
groups, showing four genetically divergent groups of P. americana in
China and USA. Haplotypes of USA group were divided into three branches
A, B and D, while the Chinese group were divided into B, C and D clades.
A combination of climatic and geological events after the later
Paleogene might drive the historical migration and genetic divergence
between these groups. In addition, 17 unique haplotypes of P. americana
and 20 haplotypes of other Periplaneta species were included for genetic
distance analysis, the sequence threshold of P. americana defined in our
case study with more extensive sampling was 5.1%. This was the first
large-scale study of genetic diversity of American cockroaches in China
and our results enriched the DNA barcode of genus Periplaneta.
